alert.note: Alert for Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 6:37PM EDT until August 25 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill and Powell. In southeast Kentucky, Lee, Morgan and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Campton, Calaboose, Stillwater, Gosneyville, Baptist, High Falls, Vortex, Trent, Valeria, Pine Ridge, Grannie, Landsaw, Toliver, Jenson, Koomer Ridge Campground, Rogers, Maytown, Malaga, Booth and Hazel Green. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
